entities.description: The estimated proportion of a population with a particular characteristic at a specific time.
Criteria for suppressing data to maintain accuracy and reliability of estimates.
The specific conditions under which data suppression is applied.
The adjusted sample size taking into account design effect and other factors to ensure reliable estimates.
A factor that measures the extent to which the variance of an estimate is inflated due to the study design.
Relative standard error, a measure of the precision of an estimate.
The estimated number associated with a given prevalence rate.
The estimated rate of prevalence within the specified criteria.

relationships.description: Defines the rules applied for data suppression in the survey.
Indicates the criteria on which data suppression rules are based.
Indicates how the design effect impacts the effective sample size.
Indicates that the prevalence rate uses relative standard error for precision.
Relates the estimated number to the estimated prevalence rate.

triplets.subject: Prevalence Rate
triplets.object: SE(Estimated prevalence rate)/Estimated prevalence rate > 0.175 when prevalence rate <= 0.5
